question: You are a student at a language school in New Zealand studying Business English. Part of the course is a summer work placement programme. Unfortunately, you have just learnt from the school that this programme has now been cancelled.Write a letter to the School Principal. In your letter:state your reason for writingdescribe the problem and your concernsexplain what you would like the Principal to do.
text: I am writing this letter with regards to express my disappointment in hearing that the work placement programme held every summer has vanished this year.

One of the main reasons I chose your school, among the many, in New Zealand was because of the work placement programme offered under my Business English course. I am majorly concerned about losing the opportunity to gain practical insights into my course along with the chance to develop and engage with local people by utilising my course knowledge. I particularly selected your school and incurred extra expenses for this golden chance of placements, and if this is not getting offered- then I am been frauded.

I would therefore humbly request if you could possibly look into reopening the summer placement programme again, otherwise, I should be getting my money back as I am not getting offered based on what was advertised.
I will look forward to your response.
